Your task is to assign a float score to the response on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Naturalness (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Is the response naturally written??
- A float score near 1 (bad) means that the response is unnatural.
- A float score near 2 (ok) means the response is strange, but not entirely unnatural.
- A float score near 3 (good) means that the response is natural.


Conversations and corresponding potential response to be evaluated:

Sample1:

Conversation History:
Speaker A: hey are you aware of banned books week ?
Speaker B: i did n't know it was a thing because i did n't realize that there are any books that are banned . what do you know about it ?
Speaker A: i think that it is a reminder of books that have been banned in the past for their controversial content , i remember it during my childhood
Speaker B: are n't most of those books now bestsellers ? i see the point of the event , but maybe it should be renamed to better reflect their current status
Speaker A: yes i think you 're right , how often do you go to the library btw ?
Speaker B: not very often since most of what i borrow through my library are ebooks and audiobooks . i love that i can access things right on my phone , though i do miss the feel of paper books

Response:
Speaker A: i do n't have a kindle , but i have n't been to the library in sacramento .

Sample2:

Conversation History:
Speaker A: hi do you watch espn ?
Speaker B: hi . yes i do sometimes . they cover some nba games .
Speaker A: yes , i am a huge bucks fan . did you see what nick friedell said about the bucks and jabari parker >
Speaker B: no i did n't . what did he say ?
Speaker A: that they should n't consider signing him . i agree .
Speaker B: what made him such a bad player last year ?
Speaker A: he did n't do much for the team and was overpaid .
Speaker B: has he been injured ? i think they are all over paid personally . i mean they make millions of dollars .
Speaker A: for sure , he had to acl injuries so he is definitely injury prone . you know who is better , reggie miller !
Speaker B: i 'm not familiar with him . does he play for the bucks too ?

Response:
Speaker A: he was a player in 1990s . he had a famous sister who played basketball named cheryl

Conversation History:

Speaker A: no i have n't . i heard it was good .
Speaker B: i have not yet either but i am aware of it 's cultural impact . it was made from a novel . apparently it is a very good romantic comedy .
Speaker A: my mother like it . i think it stars michelle yeoh , henry golding and constance wu , right ?
Speaker B: it does . apparently the basic premise is that a woman is engaged to a man and when she goes to meet his family discovers that he is insanely wealthy . his mother rejects her due to her less affluent background .
Speaker A: if i remember correctly , jon m chu is the director .
Speaker B: yes he is . it was also the first movie to feature an all - asian cast in hollywood in more than 20 years which is quite the accomplishment and i 'm glad that it did well . asians seem very underrepresented in film .
Speaker A: the movie is 121 minutes long , which is just right and is pg-13 .
Speaker B: that makes it accessible to a bigger audience which is good because then more asian - americans can see themselves represented on screen .
Speaker A: well , lets switch topics . are you a science person . , earth is the 3rd planet from the sun . it is also the only astronomical object known to harbor life .
Speaker B: i am a little . i enjoy learning about it . i was aware of those facts . i also know that if we viewed the entire earth 's history as a 24 hour period , humans would only represent 1 minute and 17 seconds of that day . that is a mind blowing stat .
Speaker A: this is mind blowing . thank god for jupiter . it saves earth from a lot of asteroids heading toward us .
Speaker B: that is really surprising since that planet is mostly compromised of gas . we do not even know if there is any solid land there . i wonder how it takes the impact first in this case ?
Speaker A: it 's very interesting . so is the fact that the sun is 4x less dense than earth .
Speaker B: i know it is much larger but i do n't think it has any solidity to it so that 's interesting . another science fact is that when earth was formed a day was only 5.5 hours long .
Speaker A: i did n't know that . i wonder why . there is a place on earth where there is less gravity than the rest of the planet . it is the hudson bay region of canada .
Speaker B: i wonder how much affect that has ? is it enough to change weights in any way ? i wonder . i do also know that we are running out of helium and will essentially be out of the gas by the end of the 21st century .

Response:
Speaker A: really , i hope that is ok for us ? i 'm also a big tech guy , how about you ? did you know new google employees are called " nooglers " .
